Invariants for subsetting and subassignment

Source: vignettes/invariants.Rmd
invariants.Rmd

This vignette defines invariants for subsetting and subset-assignment for tibbles, and illustrates where their behaviour differs from data frames. The goal is to define a small set of invariants that consistently define how behaviors interact. Some behaviors are defined using functions of the vctrs package, e.g. vctrs::vec_slice(), vctrs::vec_recycle() and vctrs::vec_as_index(). Refer to their documentation for more details about the invariants that they follow.

The subsetting and subassignment operators for data frames and tibbles are particularly tricky, because they support both row and column indexes, both of which are optionally missing. We resolve this by first defining column access with [[ and $, then column-wise subsetting with [, then row-wise subsetting, then the composition of both.

Conventions

In this article, all behaviors are demonstrated using one example data frame and its tibble equivalent:

library(vctrs)
library(tibble)
new_df <- function() {
  df <- data.frame(n = 1:4)
  df$c <- letters[5:8]
  df$li <- list(9, 10:11, 12:14, "text")
  df
}
new_tbl <- function() {
  as_tibble(new_df())
}

Results of the same code for data frames and tibbles are presented side by side:

new_df()
#>   n c         li
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
new_tbl()
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

If the results are identical (after converting to a data frame if necessary), only the tibble result is shown.

Subsetting operations are read-only. The same objects are reused in all examples:

df <- new_df()
tbl <- new_tbl()

Where needed, we also show examples with hierarchical columns containing a data frame or a matrix:

new_tbl2 <- function() {
  tibble(
    tb = tbl,
    m = diag(4)
  )
}
new_df2 <- function() {
  df2 <- new_tbl2()
  class(df2) <- "data.frame"
  class(df2$tb) <- "data.frame"
  df2
}
df2 <- new_df2()
tbl2 <- new_tbl2()
new_tbl()
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

For subset assignment (subassignment, for short), we need a fresh copy of the data for each test. The with_*() functions (omitted here for brevity) allow for a more concise notation. These functions take an assignment expression, execute it on a fresh copy of the data, and return the data for printing. The first example prints what’s really executed, further examples omit this output.

with_df(df$n <- rev(df$n), verbose = TRUE)
#> {
#>   df <- new_df()
#>   df$n <- rev(df$n)
#>   df
#> }
#>   n c         li
#> 1 4 e          9
#> 2 3 f     10, 11
#> 3 2 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 1 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$n <- rev(tbl$n), verbose = TRUE)
#> {
#>   tbl <- new_tbl()
#>   tbl$n <- rev(tbl$n)
#>   tbl
#> }
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>

Column subsetting

Definition of x[[j]]

x[[j]] is equal to .subset2(x, j).

tbl[[1]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
.subset2(tbl, 1)
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl[[3]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
.subset2(tbl, 3)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
tbl2[[1]]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
.subset2(tbl2, 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl2[[2]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    0    0    0
#> [2,]    0    1    0    0
#> [3,]    0    0    1    0
#> [4,]    0    0    0    1
 
.subset2(tbl2, 2)
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    0    0    0
#> [2,]    0    1    0    0
#> [3,]    0    0    1    0
#> [4,]    0    0    0    1

NB: x[[j]] always returns an object of size nrow(x) if the column exists.

j must be a single number or a string, as enforced by vec_as_index(j).

df[[1:2]]
#> [1] 2
 
tbl[[1:2]]
#> Warning: Calling `[[` with a vector
#> of length 2 (recursive subsetting)
#> is deprecated and will eventually be
#> converted to an error.
#> [1] 2
 
df[[c("n", "c")]]
#> Error in .subset2(x, i, exact =
#> exact): subscript out of bounds
 
tbl[[c("n", "c")]]
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
df[[TRUE]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl[[TRUE]]
#> Error in
#> error_double_bracket_logical():
#> could not find function
#> "error_double_bracket_logical"
 
df[[mean]]
#> Error in .subset2(x, i, exact =
#> exact): invalid subscript type
#> 'closure'
 
tbl[[mean]]
#> Error in .subset2(x, j): invalid
#> subscript type 'closure'

Missing and out-of-bounds (OOB) values of j return NULL with a warning or error:

df[[NA_character_]]
#> NULL
 
tbl[[NA_character_]]
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised
#> column: `NA`.
#> NULL
 
df[["x"]]
#> NULL
 
tbl[["x"]]
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised
#> column: `x`.
#> NULL
 
df[[NA_integer_]]
#> NULL
 
tbl[[NA_integer_]]
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised
#> column: `NA`.
#> NULL
 
df[[-1]]
#> Error in .subset2(x, i, exact =
#> exact): attempt to select more than
#> one element in get1index <real>
 
tbl[[-1]]
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
df[[4]]
#> Error in .subset2(x, i, exact =
#> exact): subscript out of bounds
 
tbl[[4]]
#> Error: Can't index beyond the end of
#> a vector.
#> The vector has length 3 and you've
#> tried to subset element 4.

OOB access only generates a warning because a common existing idiom is to check for the absence of a column with is.null(df$x).

Non-integer numeric values produce an error:

df[[1.5]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl[[1.5]]
#> Lossy cast from <double> to
#> <integer>.
#> Locations: 1

Definition of x$name

x$name is equal to x[["name"]].

Unlike data frames, tibbles do not partially match.

df$l
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
tbl$l
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised
#> column: `l`.
#> NULL

Definition of x[[j]] <- a.

x[[j]] <- a is equivalent to restoring to the original class after assigning the (potentially recycled) value to unclass(x):

xl <- unclass(x)
xl[[j]] <- vec_recycle(a, nrow(x))
vec_restore(xl, x)
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[3]] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c        li
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e         4
#> 2     2 f         3
#> 3     3 g         2
#> 4     4 h         1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>      tb m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     0     1     0     0     0
#> 2     0     0     1     0     0
#> 3     0     0     0     1     0
#> 4     0     0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[2]] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li           m
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     4
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     3
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     2
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     1

Corollary

[[<- requires scalar vec_as_index(j) (with the exception of new columns, see below).

with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[[1:2]] <- 0)
#> Error in x[[i]] <- value: more
#> elements supplied than there are to
#> replace
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1:2]] <- 0)
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
with_df(df[[1:3]] <- 0)
#> Error in `[[<-`(`*tmp*`, i, value =
#> value): recursive indexing failed at
#> level 2
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1:3]] <- 0)
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
with_tbl(tbl[["n"]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[[c("n", "c")]] <- 0)
#> Error in x[[i]] <- value: more
#> elements supplied than there are to
#> replace
 
with_tbl(tbl[[c("n", "c")]] <- 0)
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
with_df(df[[TRUE]] <- 0)
#>   n c         li
#> 1 0 e          9
#> 2 0 f     10, 11
#> 3 0 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 0 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[[TRUE]] <- 0)
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
with_df(df[[FALSE]] <- 0)
#> Error in x[[i]] <- value: attempt to
#> select less than one element in
#> integerOneIndex
 
with_tbl(tbl[[FALSE]] <- 0)
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
with_df(df[[NA]] <- 0)
#> Error in x[[i]] <- value: attempt to
#> select more than one element in
#> integerOneIndex
 
with_tbl(tbl[[NA]] <- 0)
#> Error in
#> error_new_columns_non_na_only():
#> could not find function
#> "error_new_columns_non_na_only"
 
with_df(df[[NA_character_]] <- 0)
#> Error in if (names(x)[nc] == "")
#> names(x)[nc] <- paste0("V", nc):
#> missing value where TRUE/FALSE
#> needed
 
with_tbl(tbl[[NA_character_]] <- 0)
#> Error in
#> error_new_columns_non_na_only():
#> could not find function
#> "error_new_columns_non_na_only"
 
with_df(df[[NA_integer_]] <- 0)
#> Error in x[[i]] <- value: attempt to
#> select more than one element in
#> integerOneIndex
 
with_tbl(tbl[[NA_integer_]] <- 0)
#> Error in
#> error_new_columns_non_na_only():
#> could not find function
#> "error_new_columns_non_na_only"

x[[j]] <- a requires vec_size(a) == nrow(x) or vec_size(a) == 1.

with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     1 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[[1]] <- 3:1)
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1, value = 3:1): replacement has 3
#> rows, data has 4
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 3:1)
#> Vector of length 3 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 4. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df(df[[1]] <- 2:1)
#>   n c         li
#> 1 2 e          9
#> 2 1 f     10, 11
#> 3 2 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 1 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 2:1)
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 4. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.

[[<- supports appending a new column at the end.

with_tbl(tbl[["x"]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       n c     li            x
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     0
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     0
 
with_df(df[[4]] <- 0)
#>   n c         li V4
#> 1 1 e          9  0
#> 2 2 f     10, 11  0
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14  0
#> 4 4 h       text  0
 
with_tbl(tbl[[4]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       n c     li         ...4
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     0
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     0
 
with_df(df[[5]] <- 0)
#> Warning in format.data.frame(if (omit)
#> x[seq_len(n0), , drop = FALSE] else
#> x, : corrupt data frame: columns will be
#> truncated or padded with NAs
#>   n c         li      V5
#> 1 1 e          9 NULL  0
#> 2 2 f     10, 11 <NA>  0
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14 <NA>  0
#> 4 4 h       text <NA>  0
 
with_tbl(tbl[[5]] <- 0)
#> Error in
#> error_new_columns_at_end_only():
#> could not find function
#> "error_new_columns_at_end_only"

[[<- supports changing the type of an existing column, also across the principal column types:

  • atomic: df[[1]] and df[[2]]
  • list: df[[3]]
  • data frame: df2[[1]]
  • matrix: df2[[2]] 
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- tbl[[2]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   n     c     li       
#>   <chr> <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[2]] <- tbl[[3]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c         li       
#>   <int> <list>    <list>   
#> 1     1 <dbl [1]> <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 <int [2]> <int [2]>
#> 3     3 <int [3]> <int [3]>
#> 4     4 <chr [1]> <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[3]] <- tbl2[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c      li$n $c    $li      
#>   <int> <chr> <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e         1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f         2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g         3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h         4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1]] <- tbl2[[2]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   tb[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4] m[,1]  [,2]
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1      1     0     0     0     1     0
#> 2      0     1     0     0     0     1
#> 3      0     0     1     0     0     0
#> 4      0     0     0     1     0     0
#> # … with 2 more variables: [,3] <dbl>,
#> #   [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[2]] <- tbl[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li           m
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     1
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     2
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     3
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     4

[[<- supports removing a column by assigning NULL to it.

with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- NULL)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   c     li       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[2]] <- NULL)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>    tb$n $c    $li      
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

Columns don’t have inner names.

with_df(df[["x"]] <- c(a = 4, b = 3, c = 2, d = 1))[["x"]]
#> [1] 4 3 2 1
 
with_tbl(tbl[["x"]] <- c(a = 4, b = 3, c = 2, d = 1))[["x"]]
#> a b c d 
#> 4 3 2 1
 
with_df(df[["x"]] <- rlang::set_names(letters[4:1]))[["x"]]
#> [1] "d" "c" "b" "a"
 
with_tbl(tbl[["x"]] <- rlang::set_names(letters[4:1]))[["x"]]
#>   d   c   b   a 
#> "d" "c" "b" "a"

Exception

List columns can have inner names:

with_tbl(tbl[["x"]] <- list(a = 4, b = 3, c = 2, d = 1))[["x"]]
#> $a
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> $b
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> $c
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> $d
#> [1] 1

Definition of x[j].

Equivalent to restoring .subset(x, vec_as_index(j)) to the original class.

tbl[1:2]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       n c    
#>   <int> <chr>
#> 1     1 e    
#> 2     2 f    
#> 3     3 g    
#> 4     4 h
 
tbl[0:2]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       n c    
#>   <int> <chr>
#> 1     1 e    
#> 2     2 f    
#> 3     3 g    
#> 4     4 h
 
tbl[-2]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       n li       
#>   <int> <list>   
#> 1     1 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 <int [2]>
#> 3     3 <int [3]>
#> 4     4 <chr [1]>
 
df[-1:2]
#> Error in `[.default`(df, -1:2): only
#> 0's may be mixed with negative
#> subscripts
 
tbl[-1:2]
#> Error: Can't subset with a mix of
#> negative and positive indices
 
tbl["c"]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>   c    
#>   <chr>
#> 1 e    
#> 2 f    
#> 3 g    
#> 4 h
 
tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE)]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       n li       
#>   <int> <list>   
#> 1     1 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 <int [2]>
#> 3     3 <int [3]>
#> 4     4 <chr [1]>
 
tbl[TRUE]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

Corollaries

NA columns are not supported.

df[NA]
#> Error in `[.data.frame`(df, NA):
#> undefined columns selected
 
tbl[NA]
#> Can't use NA as column index with
#> `[` at
#> position 1.
 
df[NA_integer_]
#> Error in `[.data.frame`(df,
#> NA_integer_): undefined columns
#> selected
 
tbl[NA_integer_]
#> Can't use NA as column index with
#> `[` at
#> position 1.
 
df[NA_character_]
#> Error in `[.data.frame`(df,
#> NA_character_): undefined columns
#> selected
 
tbl[NA_character_]
#> Can't use NA as column index with
#> `[` at
#> position 1.

Out-of-bounds indexing (and recycling of logical vectors of size > 1) is not supported.

df[4]
#> Error in `[.data.frame`(df, 4):
#> undefined columns selected
 
tbl[4]
#> Error: Can't index beyond the end of
#> a vector.
#> The vector has length 3 and you've
#> tried to subset element 4.
 
df[-4]
#>   n c         li
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
tbl[-4]
#> Error: Can't index beyond the end of
#> a vector.
#> The vector has length 3 and you've
#> tried to subset element 4.
 
df["x"]
#> Error in `[.data.frame`(df, "x"):
#> undefined columns selected
 
tbl["x"]
#> Error: Can't index non-existing
#> elements.
 
df[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE)]
#>   n         li
#> 1 1          9
#> 2 2     10, 11
#> 3 3 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4       text
 
tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE)]
#> Error: Logical indices must have
#> length 1 or be as long as the
#> indexed vector.
#> The vector has size 3 whereas the
#> index has size 4.
 
df[c(TRUE, FALSE)]
#>   n         li
#> 1 1          9
#> 2 2     10, 11
#> 3 3 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4       text
 
tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE)]
#> Error: Logical indices must have
#> length 1 or be as long as the
#> indexed vector.
#> The vector has size 3 whereas the
#> index has size 2.

x[j] retains the number of rows in the input.

nrow(tbl[])
#> [1] 4
 
nrow(tbl[1])
#> [1] 4
 
nrow(tbl[3])
#> [1] 4
 
nrow(tbl2[1])
#> [1] 4
 
nrow(tbl2[2])
#> [1] 4

Definition of x[j] <- list(...).

x[j] <- a is equivalent to converting j to column indexes or column names and performing x[[jj]] <- ... in a loop.

For converting indexes, the following (internal) function is used.

# With logic for defining names of new columns, see below
j <- vec_as_new_col_index(j, x, a)
# Existing columns
tibble:::vec_as_new_col_index(2:3, df, list(2, 3))
#>     
#> 2 3
tibble:::vec_as_new_col_index(-3, df, list(2, 3))
#>     
#> 1 2
tibble:::vec_as_new_col_index(c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), df, list(2, 3))
#> [1] 1 3
#
#
# New columns
tibble:::vec_as_new_col_index("x", df, list(y = 0))
#>  x 
#> NA
tibble:::vec_as_new_col_index(4, df, list(y = 0))
#>  y 
#> NA
tibble:::vec_as_new_col_index(4, df, list(0))
#> ...4 
#>   NA
#
#
# Errors
tibble:::vec_as_new_col_index(NA, df, list(0))
#> Error in error_new_columns_non_na_only(): could not find function "error_new_columns_non_na_only"
tibble:::vec_as_new_col_index(NA_integer_, df, list(0))
#> Error in error_new_columns_non_na_only(): could not find function "error_new_columns_non_na_only"
tibble:::vec_as_new_col_index(NA_character_, df, list(0))
#> Error in error_new_columns_non_na_only(): could not find function "error_new_columns_non_na_only"
tibble:::vec_as_new_col_index(5, df, list(0))
#> Error in error_new_columns_at_end_only(): could not find function "error_new_columns_at_end_only"

For accessing the name or index of a target column, the following helper is used:

index_or_name <- function(j, ja) {
  index <- j[[ja]]
  if (!is.na(index)) index else names(j)[[ja]]
}

Below is a simple version of the update loop:

# Create, update or remove, indexed by position
for (ja in seq_along(j)) {
  jx <- index_or_name(j, ja)
  x[[jx]] <- a[[ja]] # with implicit recycling
}

Adding, updating and removing columns may occur in arbitrary order. A robust implementation that avoids index mismatches might look more like this:

a_null <- map_lgl(a, is_null)

# Create or update, indexed by position
for (ja in which(!a_null)) {
  jx <- index_or_name(j, ja)
  x[[jx]] <- a[[ja]] # with implicit recycling
}

# Remove
j_remove <- j[a_null]
if (has_length(j_remove)) x <- x[-j_remove]
with_tbl(tbl[1:2] <- list("x", 4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   n         c li       
#>   <chr> <int> <list>   
#> 1 x         4 <dbl [1]>
#> 2 x         3 <int [2]>
#> 3 x         2 <int [3]>
#> 4 x         1 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[c("li", "x", "c")] <- list("x", 4:1, NULL))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n li        x
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 x         4
#> 2     2 x         3
#> 3     3 x         2
#> 4     4 x         1
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:2] <- list(NULL, 4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       c li       
#>   <int> <list>   
#> 1     4 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 <int [2]>
#> 3     2 <int [3]>
#> 4     1 <chr [1]>

Corollaries

NA indexes are not supported.

with_df(df[NA] <- list("x"))
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> NA, value = list("x")): missing
#> values are not allowed in
#> subscripted assignments of data
#> frames
 
with_tbl(tbl[NA] <- list("x"))
#> Error in
#> error_new_columns_non_na_only():
#> could not find function
#> "error_new_columns_non_na_only"
 
with_df(df[NA_integer_] <- list("x"))
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> NA_integer_, value = list("x")):
#> missing values are not allowed in
#> subscripted assignments of data
#> frames
 
with_tbl(tbl[NA_integer_] <- list("x"))
#> Error in
#> error_new_columns_non_na_only():
#> could not find function
#> "error_new_columns_non_na_only"
 
with_df(df[NA_character_] <- list("x"))
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> NA_character_, value = list("x")):
#> missing values are not allowed in
#> subscripted assignments of data
#> frames
 
with_tbl(tbl[NA_character_] <- list("x"))
#> Error in
#> error_new_columns_non_na_only():
#> could not find function
#> "error_new_columns_non_na_only"

[<- supports changing the type of an existing column, also across the principal column types:

  • atomic: df[[1]] and df[[2]]
  • list: df[[3]]
  • data frame: df2[[1]]
  • matrix: df2[[2]] 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- tbl[2])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   n     c     li       
#>   <chr> <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2] <- tbl[3])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c         li       
#>   <int> <list>    <list>   
#> 1     1 <dbl [1]> <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 <int [2]> <int [2]>
#> 3     3 <int [3]> <int [3]>
#> 4     4 <chr [1]> <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[3] <- tbl2[1])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c      li$n $c    $li      
#>   <int> <chr> <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e         1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f         2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g         3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h         4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1] <- tbl2[2])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   tb[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4] m[,1]  [,2]
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1      1     0     0     0     1     0
#> 2      0     1     0     0     0     1
#> 3      0     0     1     0     0     0
#> 4      0     0     0     1     0     0
#> # … with 2 more variables: [,3] <dbl>,
#> #   [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2] <- tbl[1])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li           m
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     1
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     2
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     3
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     4

Appending columns at the end (without gaps) is supported. The name of new columns is determined by the LHS, the RHS, or by name repair (in that order of precedence).

with_tbl(tbl[c("x", "y")] <- tibble("x", x = 4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 5
#>       n c     li        x         y
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]> x         4
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]> x         3
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]> x         2
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]> x         1
 
with_tbl(tbl[3:4] <- list("x", x = 4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       n c     li        x
#>   <int> <chr> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e     x         4
#> 2     2 f     x         3
#> 3     3 g     x         2
#> 4     4 h     x         1
 
with_df(df[4] <- list(4:1))
#>   n c         li V4
#> 1 1 e          9  4
#> 2 2 f     10, 11  3
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14  2
#> 4 4 h       text  1
 
with_tbl(tbl[4] <- list(4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       n c     li         ...4
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     4
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     3
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     2
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     1
 
with_df(df[5] <- list(4:1))
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 5, value = list(4:1)): new columns
#> would leave holes after existing
#> columns
 
with_tbl(tbl[5] <- list(4:1))
#> Error in
#> error_new_columns_at_end_only():
#> could not find function
#> "error_new_columns_at_end_only"

x[j] and x[[j]] can be used interchangeably on the LHS or RHS of an assignment:

with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- tbl[[3]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   n         c     li       
#>   <list>    <chr> <list>   
#> 1 <dbl [1]> e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 <int [2]> f     <int [2]>
#> 3 <int [3]> g     <int [3]>
#> 4 <chr [1]> h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(tbl[[3]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   n         c     li       
#>   <list>    <chr> <list>   
#> 1 <dbl [1]> e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 <int [2]> f     <int [2]>
#> 3 <int [3]> g     <int [3]>
#> 4 <chr [1]> h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[3]] <- tbl[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c        li
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e         1
#> 2     2 f         2
#> 3     3 g         3
#> 4     4 h         4
 
with_tbl(tbl[3] <- list(tbl[[1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c        li
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e         1
#> 2     2 f         2
#> 3     3 g         3
#> 4     4 h         4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1]] <- tbl[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>      tb m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1     1     0     0     0
#> 2     2     0     1     0     0
#> 3     3     0     0     1     0
#> 4     4     0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1] <- list(tbl[[1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>      tb m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1     1     0     0     0
#> 2     2     0     1     0     0
#> 3     3     0     0     1     0
#> 4     4     0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[2]] <- tbl[[3]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li       m        
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]> <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]> <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]> <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]> <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2] <- list(tbl[[3]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li       m        
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]> <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]> <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]> <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]> <chr [1]>

Definition of x[j] <- list(a).

x[j] <- a is equivalent to x[j] <- rep_along(j, a) if is_list(a, 1).

with_tbl(tbl[1:2] <- list(0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n     c li       
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <list>   
#> 1     0     0 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0     0 <int [2]>
#> 3     0     0 <int [3]>
#> 4     0     0 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:2] <- list(0, 0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n     c li       
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <list>   
#> 1     0     0 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0     0 <int [2]>
#> 3     0     0 <int [3]>
#> 4     0     0 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:3] <- list(0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n     c    li
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     0     0     0
#> 2     0     0     0
#> 3     0     0     0
#> 4     0     0     0
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:3] <- list(0, 0, 0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n     c    li
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     0     0     0
#> 2     0     0     0
#> 3     0     0     0
#> 4     0     0     0

Corollary

Only lists of length one on the RHS are recycled.

with_df(df[1:2] <- list(0, 0, 0))
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1:2, value = list(0, 0, 0)): provided 3
#> variables to replace 2 variables
#>   n c         li
#> 1 0 0          9
#> 2 0 0     10, 11
#> 3 0 0 12, 13, 14
#> 4 0 0       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:2] <- list(0, 0, 0))
#> Vector of length 3 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 2. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df(df[1:3] <- list(0, 0))
#>   n c li
#> 1 0 0  0
#> 2 0 0  0
#> 3 0 0  0
#> 4 0 0  0
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:3] <- list(0, 0))
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 3. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.

Definition of x[j] <- a.

x[j] <- a is equivalent to x[j] <- list(a) if is_atomic(a) or is_null(a).

with_tbl(tbl[1] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- NULL)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   c     li       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(NULL))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   c     li       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     <chr [1]>

Rows

Definition of x[i, ].

Applies vec_slice(, i) to all columns, for both subsetting and subassignment.

tbl[2:3, ]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 2     3 g     <int [3]>
 
tbl[0:2, ]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
 
tbl[0, ]
#> # A tibble: 0 x 3
#> # … with 3 variables: n <int>, c <chr>,
#> #   li <list>
 
tbl[-2, ]
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 3     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
df[-1:2, ]
#> Error in xj[i]: only 0's may be
#> mixed with negative subscripts
 
tbl[-1:2, ]
#> Error: Can't subset with a mix of
#> negative and positive indices
 
tbl[NA_integer_, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       n c     li    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
tbl2[NA_integer_, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li    m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>    NA    NA    NA
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
tbl[c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE), ]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 2     3 g     <int [3]>
 
tbl[TRUE, ]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl[FALSE, ]
#> # A tibble: 0 x 3
#> # … with 3 variables: n <int>, c <chr>,
#> #   li <list>
 
tbl[NA, ]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 2    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 3    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 4    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[0:2, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[0, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[-2, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
with_df(df[-1:2, ] <- df[1, ])
#> Error in seq_len(nrows)[i]: only 0's
#> may be mixed with negative
#> subscripts
 
with_tbl(tbl[-1:2, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Error: Can't subset with a mix of
#> negative and positive indices
 
with_df(df[NA_integer_, ] <- df[1, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> NA_integer_, , value =
#> structure(list(: missing values are
#> not allowed in subscripted
#> assignments of data frames
 
with_tbl(tbl[NA_integer_, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Error in error_na_new_row(): could
#> not find function "error_na_new_row"
 
with_df2(df2[NA_integer_, ] <- df2[1, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> NA_integer_, , value =
#> structure(list(: missing values are
#> not allowed in subscripted
#> assignments of data frames
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[NA_integer_, ] <- tbl2[1, ])
#> Error in error_na_new_row(): could
#> not find function "error_na_new_row"
 
with_tbl(tbl[c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE), ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[TRUE, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[FALSE, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[NA, ] <- df[1, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> NA, , value = structure(list(n = 1L,
#> : missing values are not allowed in
#> subscripted assignments of data
#> frames
 
with_tbl(tbl[NA, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Error in error_na_new_row(): could
#> not find function "error_na_new_row"

Corollary

For logical vectors, out-of-bounds indexing and recycling of size > 1 are not supported. (Character and numeric vectors are exceptions that are discussed below.)

df[c(TRUE, FALSE), ]
#>   n c         li
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
 
tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE), ]
#> Warning: Length of logical index must be
#> 1 or 4, not 2
#> # A tibble: 2 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 g     <int [3]>
 
df[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), ]
#>     n    c         li
#> 1   1    e          9
#> 3   3    g 12, 13, 14
#> NA NA <NA>       NULL
 
tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), ]
#> Warning: Length of logical index must be
#> 1 or 4, not 5
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 3    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
with_df(df[c(TRUE, FALSE), ] <- df[1, ])
#>   n c     li
#> 1 1 e      9
#> 2 2 f 10, 11
#> 3 1 e      9
#> 4 4 h   text
 
with_tbl(tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE), ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Error: Logical indices must have
#> length 1 or be as long as the
#> indexed vector.
#> The vector has size 4 whereas the
#> index has size 2.
 
with_df(df[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), ] <- df[1, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), :
#> non-existent rows not allowed
 
with_tbl(tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Error: Logical indices must have
#> length 1 or be as long as the
#> indexed vector.
#> The vector has size 4 whereas the
#> index has size 5.

Subassignment corollary

Only values of size one can be recycled.

with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- tbl[1:2, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[2:4, ] <- df[1:2, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2:4, , value = structure(list(n =
#> 1:2, : replacement element 1 has 2
#> rows, need 3
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:4, ] <- tbl[1:2, ])
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 3. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df2(df2[2:4, ] <- df2[1, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2:4, , value = structure(list(tb =
#> structure(list(: replacement element
#> 1 is a matrix/data frame of 1 row,
#> need 3
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2:4, ] <- tbl2[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 4     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[2:4, ] <- df2[2:3, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2:4, , value = structure(list(tb =
#> structure(list(: replacement element
#> 1 is a matrix/data frame of 2 rows,
#> need 3
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2:4, ] <- tbl2[2:3, ])
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 3. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.

Exception

For compatibility reasons only a warning is issued for indexing beyond the number of rows. Appending rows right at the end of the existing data is supported, without warning.

df[5, ]
#>     n    c   li
#> NA NA <NA> NULL
 
tbl[5, ]
#> Warning: Row indexes must be between 0
#> and the number of rows (4). Use `NA` as
#> row index to obtain a row full of `NA`
#> values.
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       n c     li    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
df[5:7, ]
#>       n    c   li
#> NA   NA <NA> NULL
#> NA.1 NA <NA> NULL
#> NA.2 NA <NA> NULL
 
tbl[5:7, ]
#> Warning: Row indexes must be between 0
#> and the number of rows (4). Use `NA` as
#> row index to obtain a row full of `NA`
#> values.
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       n c     li    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 2    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 3    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
df[6, ]
#>     n    c   li
#> NA NA <NA> NULL
 
tbl[6, ]
#> Warning: Row indexes must be between 0
#> and the number of rows (4). Use `NA` as
#> row index to obtain a row full of `NA`
#> values.
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       n c     li    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
with_tbl(tbl[5, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
#> 5     1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[5:7, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 7 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
#> 5     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 6     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 7     1 e     <dbl [1]>

#> 1  1    e          9
#> 2  2    f     10, 11
#> 3  3    g 12, 13, 14
#> 4  4    h       text

#> Error in
#> error_new_rows_at_end_only(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_new_rows_at_end_only"
 
df[-5, ]

#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
df[-6, ]
#>   n c         li
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text

#> Warning: Negative row indexes must be
#> between 0 and the number of rows negated

#> tried to subset element 5.

#>   n c li
#> 1 1 e  9
#> 2 1 e  9
#> 3 1 e  9

#> a vector.
#> The vector has length 4 and you've
#> tried to subset element 6.

For compatibility reasons, character vectors that represent numbers are supported.

tbl[as.character(1:3), ]
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
 
df[as.character(-(1:3)), ]
#>       n    c   li
#> NA   NA <NA> NULL
#> NA.1 NA <NA> NULL
#> NA.2 NA <NA> NULL
 
tbl[as.character(-(1:3)), ]
#> Warning: Only valid row names can be
#> used for indexing. Use `NA` as row index
#> to obtain a row full of `NA` values.
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       n c     li    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 2    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 3    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
df[as.character(3:5), ]
#>     n    c         li
#> 3   3    g 12, 13, 14
#> 4   4    h       text
#> NA NA <NA>       NULL
 
tbl[as.character(3:5), ]
#> Warning: Only valid row names can be
#> used for indexing. Use `NA` as row index
#> to obtain a row full of `NA` values.
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 2     4 h     <chr [1]>
#> 3    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
df[as.character(-(3:5)), ]
#>       n    c   li
#> NA   NA <NA> NULL
#> NA.1 NA <NA> NULL
#> NA.2 NA <NA> NULL
 
tbl[as.character(-(3:5)), ]
#> Warning: Only valid row names can be
#> used for indexing. Use `NA` as row index
#> to obtain a row full of `NA` values.
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       n c     li    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 2    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 3    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
tbl[NA_character_, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       n c     li    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
with_tbl(tbl[as.character(1:3), ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[as.character(-(1:3)), ] <- df[1, ])
#>    n c         li
#> 1  1 e          9
#> 2  2 f     10, 11
#> 3  3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4  4 h       text
#> -1 1 e          9
#> -2 1 e          9
#> -3 1 e          9
 
with_tbl(tbl[as.character(-(1:3)), ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Warning: Only valid row names can be
#> used for indexing. Use `NA` as row index
#> to obtain a row full of `NA` values.
#> Error in error_na_new_row(): could
#> not find function "error_na_new_row"
 
with_df(df[as.character(3:5), ] <- df[1, ])
#>   n c     li
#> 1 1 e      9
#> 2 2 f 10, 11
#> 3 1 e      9
#> 4 1 e      9
#> 5 1 e      9
 
with_tbl(tbl[as.character(3:5), ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Warning: Only valid row names can be
#> used for indexing. Use `NA` as row index
#> to obtain a row full of `NA` values.
#> Error in error_na_new_row(): could
#> not find function "error_na_new_row"
 
with_df(df[as.character(-(3:5)), ] <- df[1, ])
#>    n c         li
#> 1  1 e          9
#> 2  2 f     10, 11
#> 3  3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4  4 h       text
#> -3 1 e          9
#> -4 1 e          9
#> -5 1 e          9
 
with_tbl(tbl[as.character(-(3:5)), ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Warning: Only valid row names can be
#> used for indexing. Use `NA` as row index
#> to obtain a row full of `NA` values.
#> Error in error_na_new_row(): could
#> not find function "error_na_new_row"
 
with_df(df[NA_character_, ] <- df[1, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> NA_character_, , value =
#> structure(list(: missing values are
#> not allowed in subscripted
#> assignments of data frames
 
with_tbl(tbl[NA_character_, ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Error in error_na_new_row(): could
#> not find function "error_na_new_row"

Definition of x[i, j].

x[i, j] is equivalent to x[j][i, ].

df[1, 1]
#> [1] 1
 
tbl[1, 1]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 1
#>       n
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
 
df[1][1, ]
#> [1] 1
 
tbl[1][1, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 1
#>       n
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
 
tbl[1, 2:3]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>   c     li       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
tbl[2:3][1, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>   c     li       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
df[2:3, 1]
#> [1] 2 3
 
tbl[2:3, 1]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 1
#>       n
#>   <int>
#> 1     2
#> 2     3
 
df[1][2:3, ]
#> [1] 2 3
 
tbl[1][2:3, ]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 1
#>       n
#>   <int>
#> 1     2
#> 2     3
 
tbl2[2:3, 1:2]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 2     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
tbl2[1:2][2:3, ]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 2     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>

Corollaries

x[i, j] <- can update only existing columns, it cannot create or remove columns.

with_df(df[2:3, "n"] <- 1)
#>   n c         li
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 1 f     10, 11
#> 3 1 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, "n"] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     1 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[2:3, "x"] <- 1)
#>   n c         li  x
#> 1 1 e          9 NA
#> 2 2 f     10, 11  1
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14  1
#> 4 4 h       text NA
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, "x"] <- 1)
#> Error: Can't index non-existing
#> elements.
 
with_df(df[2:3, "n"] <- NULL)
#> Error in x[[jj]][iseq] <- vjj:
#> replacement has length zero
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, "n"] <- NULL)
#> `value` must be a vector, not NULL

x[i, j] <- can’t change the data type of existing columns.

with_df(df[2:3, 1] <- df[1:2, 2])
#>   n c         li
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 e f     10, 11
#> 3 f g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, 1] <- tbl[1:2, 2])
#> No common type for `value`
#> <character>
#> and `x` <integer>.
 
with_df(df[2:3, 2] <- df[1:2, 3])
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2:3, 2, value = list(9, 10:11)):
#> provided 2 variables to replace 1
#> variables
#>   n c         li
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 9     10, 11
#> 3 3 9 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, 2] <- tbl[1:2, 3])
#> No common type for `value` <list>
#> and
#> `x` <character>.
 
with_df(df[2:3, 3] <- df2[1:2, 1])
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2:3, 3, value = structure(list(n =
#> 1:2, : provided 3 variables to replace 1
#> variables
#>   n c   li
#> 1 1 e    9
#> 2 2 f    1
#> 3 3 g    2
#> 4 4 h text
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, 3] <- tbl2[1:2, 1])
#> No common type for `x` <tbl_df<
#> n : integer
#> c : character
#> li: list
#> >> and `y` <list>.
 
with_df2(df2[2:3, 1] <- df2[1:2, 2])
#> Warning in matrix(value, n, p): data
#> length [8] is not a sub-multiple or
#> multiple of the number of columns [3]
#>   tb.n tb.c tb.li m.1 m.2 m.3 m.4
#> 1    1    e     9   1   0   0   0
#> 2    1    0     0   0   1   0   0
#> 3    0    1     0   0   0   1   0
#> 4    4    h  text   0   0   0   1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2:3, 1] <- tbl2[1:2, 2])
#> No common type for `value`
#> <double[,4]> and `x` <tbl_df<
#> n : integer
#> c : character
#> li: list
#> >>.
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2:3, 2] <- tbl[1:2, 1])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     1     1     1
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     2     2     2
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>

x[i, j] <- can’t append rows.

with_df(df[5, "n"] <- list(0))
#>   n    c         li
#> 1 1    e          9
#> 2 2    f     10, 11
#> 3 3    g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4    h       text
#> 5 0 <NA>       NULL
 
with_tbl(tbl[5, "n"] <- list(0))
#> Vector of length 5 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 4. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.

Definition of x[[i, j]].

x[[i, j]] is equivalent to x[i, ][[j]].

tbl[[1, 1]]
#> [1] 1
 
tbl[1, ][[1]]
#> [1] 1
 
df[[1, 3]]
#> [1] 9
 
tbl[[1, 3]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
 
tbl[1, ][[3]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
 
df2[[1, 1]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl2[[1, 1]]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
tbl2[1, ][[1]]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
df2[[1, 2]]
#> [1] 1
 
tbl2[[1, 2]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    0    0    0
 
tbl2[1, ][[2]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    0    0    0
 
with_df(df[[1, 1]] <- 0)
#>   n c         li
#> 1 0 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1, 1]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[1, ][[1]] <- 0)
#>   n c         li
#> 1 0 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, ][[1]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[[1, 3]] <- list(NULL))
#>   n c         li
#> 1 1 e       NULL
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1, 3]] <- list(NULL))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <NULL>   
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, ][[3]] <- list(NULL))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <NULL>   
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df2(df2[[1, 1]] <- df[1, ])
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> iseq, value = structure(list(n = 1L,
#> : replacement has 1 row, data has 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1, 1]] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1, ][[1]] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[[1, 2]] <- t(1:4))
#> Error in x[[jseq]][[iseq]] <- value:
#> more elements supplied than there
#> are to replace
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1, 2]] <- t(1:4))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     2     3
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1, ][[2]] <- t(1:4))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     2     3
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>

vec_as_index(i) must be scalar.

df[[1:2, 1]]
#> Error in col[[i, exact = exact]]:
#> attempt to select more than one
#> element in vectorIndex
 
tbl[[1:2, 1]]
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
with_df(df[[1:2, 1]] <- 0)
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1:2, 1, value = 0): only a single
#> element should be replaced
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1:2, 1]] <- 0)
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"

Corollaries

x[[i, j]] always returns an object of size 1.

vec_size(tbl[[2, 1]])
#> [1] 1
 
vec_size(df[[2, 3]])
#> [1] 2
 
vec_size(tbl[[2, 3]])
#> [1] 1
 
vec_size(df2[[2, 1]])
#> [1] 4
 
vec_size(tbl2[[2, 1]])
#> [1] 1
 
vec_size(tbl2[[2, 2]])
#> [1] 1
 
vec_size(df[[NA, 1]])
#> Error in col[[i, exact = exact]]:
#> subscript out of bounds
 
vec_size(tbl[[NA, 1]])
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
vec_size(df[[NA, 3]])
#> [1] 0
 
vec_size(tbl[[NA, 3]])
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
vec_size(df2[[NA, 1]])
#> [1] 0
 
vec_size(tbl2[[NA, 1]])
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
vec_size(df2[[NA, 2]])
#> Error in col[[i, exact = exact]]:
#> subscript out of bounds
 
vec_size(tbl2[[NA, 2]])
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"

x[[i, j]] and x[i, ][[j]] can be used interchangeably on the LHS or RHS of an assignment for the four principal column types:

  • atomic: df[[1]]
  • list: df[[3]]
  • data frame: df2[[1]]
  • matrix: df2[[2]] 
with_tbl(tbl[[1, 1]] <- tbl[2, ][[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     2 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, 1] <- list(tbl[[2, 1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     2 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[[1, 3]] <- df[2, ][[3]])
#>   n c         li
#> 1 1 e     10, 11
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1, 3]] <- tbl[2, ][[3]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <int [2]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[1, 3] <- list(df[[2, 3]]))
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1, 3, value = list(10:11)): replacement
#> element 1 has 2 rows to replace 1 rows
#>   n c         li
#> 1 1 e         10
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, 3] <- list(tbl[[2, 3]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <int [2]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df2(df2[[1, 1]] <- df2[2, ][[1]])
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> iseq, value = structure(list(n = 2L,
#> : replacement has 1 row, data has 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1, 1]] <- tbl2[2, ][[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     2 f     <int [2…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[1, 1] <- list(df2[[2, 1]]))
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1, 1, value = list(c("e", "f", "g", :
#> replacement element 1 has 4 rows to
#> replace 1 rows
#>   tb.n tb.c      tb.li m.1 m.2 m.3 m.4
#> 1    e    e          e   1   0   0   0
#> 2    2    f     10, 11   0   1   0   0
#> 3    3    g 12, 13, 14   0   0   1   0
#> 4    4    h       text   0   0   0   1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1, 1] <- list(tbl2[[2, 1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     2 f     <int [2…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[[1, 2]] <- df2[2, ][[2]])
#> Error in x[[jseq]][[iseq]] <- value:
#> more elements supplied than there
#> are to replace
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1, 2]] <- tbl2[2, ][[2]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     0     1     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[1, 2] <- list(df2[[2, 2]]))
#>   tb.n tb.c      tb.li m.1 m.2 m.3 m.4
#> 1    1    e          9   0   0   0   0
#> 2    2    f     10, 11   0   1   0   0
#> 3    3    g 12, 13, 14   0   0   1   0
#> 4    4    h       text   0   0   0   1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1, 2] <- list(tbl2[[2, 2]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     0     1     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>

x[[i, j]] is equivalent to x[i, j][[1]] with the additional requirement vec_as_index(i) and vec_as_index(j) scalar.

tbl[[1, 2]]
#> [1] "e"
 
tbl[1, 2][[1]]
#> [1] "e"
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1, 2]] <- "x")
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, 2] <- list("x"))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

x[[i, ]] is not supported.

df[[1, ]]
#> Error in `[[.data.frame`(df, 1, ):
#> argument "..2" is missing, with no
#> default
 
tbl[[1, ]]
#> Error in
#> error_missing_column_index(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_missing_column_index"
 
with_df(df[[1, ]] <- 0)
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1, , value = 0): only valid calls
#> are x[[j]] <- value or x[[i,j]] <-
#> value
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1, ]] <- 0)
#> Error in
#> error_missing_column_index(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_missing_column_index"

Missing j indexes

Definition of x[].

x[] is equivalent to x[seq_len(ncol(x))].

tbl[]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- tbl)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
with_df(df[] <- df[1:2, ])
#>   n c     li
#> 1 1 e      9
#> 2 2 f 10, 11
#> 3 1 e      9
#> 4 2 f 10, 11
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- tbl[1:2, ])
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 4. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df(df[] <- df2)
#>   n.n n.c       n.li c.1 c.2 c.3 c.4
#> 1   1   e          9   1   0   0   0
#> 2   2   f     10, 11   0   1   0   0
#> 3   3   g 12, 13, 14   0   0   1   0
#> 4   4   h       text   0   0   0   1
#>   li.n li.c      li.li
#> 1    1    e          9
#> 2    2    f     10, 11
#> 3    3    g 12, 13, 14
#> 4    4    h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- tbl2)
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 3. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
tbl2[]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[] <- tbl2)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[] <- df2[1, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, ,
#> value = structure(list(tb =
#> structure(list(: replacement element
#> 1 is a matrix/data frame of 1 row,
#> need 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[] <- tbl2[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 4     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[] <- df2[1:2, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, ,
#> value = structure(list(tb =
#> structure(list(: replacement element
#> 1 is a matrix/data frame of 2 rows,
#> need 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[] <- tbl2[1:2, ])
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 4. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df2(df2[] <- df)
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, ,
#> value = structure(list(n = 1:4, c =
#> c("e", : provided 3 variables to replace
#> 2 variables
#>   tb m
#> 1  1 e
#> 2  2 f
#> 3  3 g
#> 4  4 h
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[] <- tbl)
#> Vector of length 3 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 2. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.

Definition of x[, j].

x[, j] is equivalent to x[j].

tbl[, 2:3]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   c     li       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl[2:3]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   c     li       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl2[, 1:2]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
tbl2[1:2]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl(tbl[, 2:3] <- tbl[1:2])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n     c li   
#>   <int> <int> <chr>
#> 1     1     1 e    
#> 2     2     2 f    
#> 3     3     3 g    
#> 4     4     4 h
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3] <- tbl[1:2])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n     c li   
#>   <int> <int> <chr>
#> 1     1     1 e    
#> 2     2     2 f    
#> 3     3     3 g    
#> 4     4     4 h
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[, 1:2] <- tbl2[2:1])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   tb[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]   m$n $c   
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <chr>
#> 1      1     0     0     0     1 e    
#> 2      0     1     0     0     2 f    
#> 3      0     0     1     0     3 g    
#> 4      0     0     0     1     4 h    
#> # … with 1 more variable: $li <list>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1:2] <- tbl2[2:1])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   tb[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]   m$n $c   
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <chr>
#> 1      1     0     0     0     1 e    
#> 2      0     1     0     0     2 f    
#> 3      0     0     1     0     3 g    
#> 4      0     0     0     1     4 h    
#> # … with 1 more variable: $li <list>

Corollaries

[ always returns a tibble.

df[, 1]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl[, 1]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       n
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
tbl[1]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       n
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
tbl[, 1, drop = FALSE]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       n
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
df[1, drop = FALSE]
#> Warning in `[.data.frame`(df, 1, drop =
#> FALSE): 'drop' argument will be ignored
#>   n
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3
#> 4 4
 
tbl[1, drop = FALSE]
#> Warning: `drop` ignored
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       n
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4

x[,] is equivalent to x[].

tbl[,]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[,] <- tbl)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[,] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
with_df(df[,] <- df[1:2, ])
#>   n c     li
#> 1 1 e      9
#> 2 2 f 10, 11
#> 3 1 e      9
#> 4 2 f 10, 11
 
with_tbl(tbl[,] <- tbl[1:2, ])
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 4. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df(df[,] <- df2)
#>   n.n n.c       n.li c.1 c.2 c.3 c.4
#> 1   1   e          9   1   0   0   0
#> 2   2   f     10, 11   0   1   0   0
#> 3   3   g 12, 13, 14   0   0   1   0
#> 4   4   h       text   0   0   0   1
#>   li.n li.c      li.li
#> 1    1    e          9
#> 2    2    f     10, 11
#> 3    3    g 12, 13, 14
#> 4    4    h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[,] <- tbl2)
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 3. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
tbl2[,]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[,] <- tbl2)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[,] <- df2[1, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, ,
#> , value = structure(list(tb =
#> structure(list(: replacement element
#> 1 is a matrix/data frame of 1 row,
#> need 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[,] <- tbl2[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>    tb$n $c    $li      m[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 4     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[,] <- df2[1:2, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, ,
#> , value = structure(list(tb =
#> structure(list(: replacement element
#> 1 is a matrix/data frame of 2 rows,
#> need 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[,] <- tbl2[1:2, ])
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 4. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df2(df2[,] <- df)
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, , ,
#> value = structure(list(n = 1:4, :
#> provided 3 variables to replace 2
#> variables
#>   tb m
#> 1  1 e
#> 2  2 f
#> 3  3 g
#> 4  4 h
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[,] <- tbl)
#> Vector of length 3 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 2. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.

Exception

drop = TRUE returns a vector when subsetting a single column with x[, j], this is for backward compatibility with code that uses an explicit drop = TRUE to access columns as vectors.

tbl[, 1, drop = TRUE]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
df[1, , drop = TRUE]
#> $n
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $c
#> [1] "e"
#> 
#> $li
#> $li[[1]]
#> [1] 9
 
tbl[1, , drop = TRUE]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       n c     li       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
stopifnot(identical(tbl, new_tbl()))

  • Rows
    • Definition of x[i, ].
    • Definition of x[i, j].

tibble is a part of the tidyverse, an ecosystem of packages designed with common APIs and a shared philosophy. Learn more at tidyverse.org.
